contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Long-furred woolly mouse opossum<ref name = msw3>{{MSW3 Didelphimorphia | id = 10400119 | page = 13}}</ref> | status = LC | status_system = iucn3.1 | status_ref = <ref name=iucn>{{IUCN2011.2|assessors=Brito, D., Astua de Moraes, D. & Soriano, P.|year=2011|id=40510|title=Marmosa demerarae|downloaded=18 January 2012}} Database entry includes justification for why this species is of least concern </ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | infraclassis = [[Marsupialia]] | ordo = [[Didelphimorphia]] | familia = [[Didelphidae]] | genus = ''[[Marmosa]]'' | subgenus = ''[[Micoureus]]'' | species = '''''M. demerarae''''' | binomial = ''Marmosa demerarae'' | binomial_authority = ([[Michael Rogers Oldfield Thomas|Thomas]], 1905) | synonyms = ''Micoureus demerarae'' <small>(Thomas, 1905)</small> | range_map = Long-furred Woolly Mouse Opossum area.png | range_map_caption = Long-furred woolly mouse opossum range }} The '''woolly mouse opossum''' or '''long-furred woolly mouse opossum''' (''Marmosa demerarae''), known locally as the '''Cuíca''',<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ecoparque.org.br/biodiversidade2.htm | title = Ecoparque de Una}}</ref> is a [[South America]]n [[marsupial]] of the family [[Didelphidae]].<ref name = MSW3>{{MSW3 Didelphimorphia | id = 10400119 | page =13}}</ref> Its range includes central [[Colombia]], [[Venezuela]], [[French Guiana]], [[Guyana]], [[Suriname]], eastern [[Peru]], northern [[Bolivia]], and northern [[Brazil]].<ref name="GardnerCreighton2007">{{cite book|last1=Gardner|first1=A.L.|last2=Creighton|first2=G.K.|editor=Gardner, A.L. (ed.)|title=Mammals of South America. Volume 1: Marsupials, Xenarthrans, Shrews, and Bats|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=dbU3d7EUCm8C&pg=PA507|year=2007|publisher=University of Chicago Press|isbn=978-0-226-28240-4|page=77|chapter=Genus ''Micoureus''}}</ref> It was formerly assigned to the genus ''[[Micoureus]]'', which was made a subgenus of ''[[Marmosa]]'' in 2009.<ref name = "Voss">{{cite journal | last = Voss | first = R. S. | authorlink = | coauthors = Jansa, S. A. | title = Phylogenetic relationships and classification of didelphid marsupials, an extant radiation of New World metatherian mammals | journal = [[Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History]] | volume = 322 | issue = | pages = 1–177 | publisher = | location = | date = 2009 | language = | id = {{hdl|2246/5975}} | doi = | accessdate = 2012-01-18}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Didelphimorphia|D.1}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mouse Opossum, woolly}} [[Category:Opossums|Woolly mouse opossum]] [[Category:Fauna of the Amazon]] [[Category:Mammals of Brazil]] [[Category:Mammals of Colombia]] [[Category:Fauna of French Guiana]] [[Category:Mammals of Guyana]] [[Category:Mammals of Paraguay]] [[Category:Fauna of Suriname]] [[Category:Mammals of Venezuela]] {{marsupial-stub}}
